question:
The wing of an aircraft in flight, powered by engines located under the wing, is subjected to a
bending moment due to thrust and drag. The loading on the front spar of the torsion box from
the wing root to the wing tip is:
answer: compression, and then tension.
choiceone: tension.
choicetwo: tension, and then compression.
choicethree: compression.

question: In a commercial transport aircraft the landing gear operating system is usually:
answer: Hydraulically driven.
choiceone: Mechanically driven.
choicetwo: Electrically driven.
choicethree: Pneumatically driven.

question: VLO is the maximum:
answer: speed at which the landing gear can be operated with full safety.
choiceone: flight speed with landing gear down.
choicetwo: cruising speed not to be exceeded except in still air with caution.
choicethree: speed with flaps extended in a given position.

question: Tyre "creep" may be described as the:
answer: circumferential movement of the tyre in relation to the wheel flange.
choiceone: the decrease in inflation pressure due to increase in ambient temperature.
choicetwo: gradual circumferential increase of tyre wear.
choicethree: the increase in inflation pressure due to decrease in ambient temperature.

question: The ABS (Auto Brake System) is being disconnected after landing ..
answer: by pilot action
choiceone: automatically
choicetwo: at a certain low speed
choicethree: the system is always armed

question: On an aircraft landing gear, an under-inflated tyre:
answer: will wear at the shoulders
choiceone: will have an increased critical hydroplaning speed
choicetwo: it's tread will deteriorate faster
choicethree: will be more subject to viscosity aquaplaning on dry runway

question: The purpose of a trim tab (device) is to:
answer: reduce or to cancel control forces.
choiceone: trim the aeroplane at low airspeed.
choicetwo: trim the aeroplane during normal flight.
choicethree: lower manoeuvring control forces.

question: On an airplane, the Krueger flaps are:
answer: leading edge flaps close to the wing root
choiceone: trailing edge flaps close to the wing root
choicetwo: leading edge flaps close to the wing tip
choicethree: trailing edge flaps close to the wing tip

question: Hydraulic power is a function of:
answer: System pressure and volume flow.
choiceone: Pump RPM only.
choicetwo: System pressure and tank capacity.
choicethree: Pump size and volume flow.

question: The component that converts hydraulic pressure into linear motion is called:
answer: An actuator or jack.
choiceone: A pressure regulator.
choicetwo: An accumulator.
choicethree: A hydraulic pump.

question: The aircraft hydraulic system is designed to produce:
answer: high pressure and large flow.
choiceone: high pressure and small flow.
choicetwo: small pressure and small flow.
choicethree: small pressure and large flow.

question: The type of hydraulic fluid which has the greatest resistance to cavitation is:
answer: Synthetic fluid.
choiceone: Mineral oil based fluid.
choicetwo: Vegetable oil based fluid (caster oil).
choicethree: Water and glycol based fluid.

question:
In the hydraulic press schematically shown, what balancing Force would be acting on the right
hand side ? (The diagram is not to scale)
For an aeroplane hydraulic supply circuit, the correct statement is:
answer:
the security components comprise the filters, the pressure relief valves, the by-passes, and
the fire shut-off valve.
choiceone:
the regulation system deals only with emergency operation and is not applied to all
hydraulic services but only those considered as essential.
choicetwo:
the pumps are always electric due to the high pressures which they must deliver (140 to
210 kg/cm²).
choicethree:
the reservoir constitutes a reserve of hydraulic fluid maintained under pressure by a
pneumatic back pressure (air or nitrogen) and destined to serve as a fluid or pressure
reserve.

question: The term "pressure cabin" applies when an aeroplane:
answer: has the means to maintain cabin pressure higher than ambient pressure.
choiceone: has the ability to maintain a constant cabin differential pressure at all flight altitudes.
choicetwo: is only pressurised in the area of the control cabin.
choicethree: has the ability to maintain a constant cabin altitude at all flight altitudes.

question: During flight, the wing anti-ice system has to protect
answer: a part of the whole leading edge.
choiceone: the whole leading edge and the whole upper wing surface.
choicetwo: the whole upper wing surface and the flaps.
choicethree: slats and the leading edge flaps only.

question: In jet aeroplanes the 'thermal anti-ice system' is primarily supplied by

choicetwo: the APU.
choicethree: ram air, heated via a heat exchanger.

choiceone: with hot air.
choicetwo: pneumatically.
choicethree: with anti-icing fluid.

question: Regarding a thermal wing anti-icing system, the correct statement is:

Aerodynamic performances of the wings are maintained and there is a reduction of
maximum engine thrust.
choiceone:
Aerodynamic performances of the wings are not maintained and there is a reduction of
maximum engine thrust.
choicetwo:
Aerodynamic performances of the wings are not maintained and there is no reduction of
maximum engine thrust.
choicethree:
Aerodynamic performances of the wings are maintained and there is no reduction of
maximum engine thrust.

question: On modern transport aircraft, cockpit windows are protected against icing by:

choicethree: Vinyl coating.

question: The types of fuel tanks used on most modern transport aircraft are:
answer: Integral tanks.
choiceone: Cell tanks.
choicetwo: Combined fuel tanks.
choicethree: Fixed built-in tanks.

choicetwo: electro-mechanical wobble pumps, with self-regulated pressure.

question: The rating of electrical fuses is expressed in:

choiceone: watts.
choicetwo: volts.
choicethree: ohms.

question: Regarding Ohm's law:
answer: The current in a circuit is directly proportional to voltage.
choiceone: The current in a circuit is directly proportional to the resistance of the circuit.
choicetwo: The power in the circuit is inversely proportional to the square of the current.
choicethree: The current in a circuit is inversely proportional to voltage.

question:
The resistors R1 and R2 are connected in parallel. The value of the equivalent resistance (Req)
so obtained is given by the formula:
choiceone: Req = R1 + R2
choicethree: Req = R1 x R2

question: If one of the 12 cells of a lead-acid battery is dead, the battery:
answer: is unserviceable.
choiceone: has 1/12 less voltage and less capacity, but can still be used.
choicetwo: has 1/12 less voltage, but can still be used.
choicethree: has 1/12 less capacity, but can still be used.

question: Circuit breakers protecting circuits may be:
answer: used in AC and DC circuits.
choiceone: used only in AC circuits.
choicetwo: reset at any time.
choicethree: used only in DC circuits.

question: A "trip-free" type circuit breaker is a circuit protection device which:

choicetwo: is free from the normal CB tripping characteristic.
choicethree: will allow the contacts to be held closed in order to clear a fault in the circuit.

question: The output of a generator is controlled by:

choicetwo: varying the speed of the engine.

choiceone: series with the armature.
choicetwo: parallel with the shunt field coil.
choicethree: parallel with the armature.

question:
A CSD of an AC generator may be disconnected in flight. The primary reason(s) for

answer: low oil pressure and/or high oil temperature of the generator drive.

choicetwo: illumination of the CSD disconnect warning light.
choicethree: slight variation about the normal operating frequency.

choiceone: batteries at varying loads.
choicetwo: generators at varying speeds and the batteries at varying loads.

question: A magnetic circuit-breaker is:

choiceone: can be reset without any danger even when fault remains.
choicetwo: permits an overcurrent limited in time.
choicethree: is a system with a slow response time.

question:
In an aeroplane fitted with a constant frequency AC power supply, DC power is obtained from
a:
answer: transformer rectifier unit (TRU).
choiceone: rotary converter.
choicetwo: static inverter.
choicethree: 3 phase current transformer unit.

question: Ignition occurs in each cylinder of a four stroke engine (TDC = Top Dead Centre):

choiceone: behind TDC at each second crankshaft revolution.
choicetwo: behind TDC at each crankshaft revolution.
choicethree: before TDC at each crankshaft revolution.

question: The crank assembly consists of

choicetwo: Crankcase, crankshaft, connecting rods and pistons.

question:

choiceone: intake valve closed and exhaust valve open.
choicetwo: exhaust valve closed and intake valve open.

question: A piston engine compression ratio is the ratio of the:

choicetwo: total volume to the swept volume.

volume of the cylinder with the piston at bottom dead centre to that with the piston at top

question: The ignition system generally used for small aircrafts is a:
answer: High tension system.
choiceone: Low tension system.
choicetwo: High intensity system.
choicethree: Battery ignition system.

question:
In a piston engine, magnetos are used to produce the spark which ignites the fuel/air mixture.

breaking the primary current in order to induce a low amp high volt current which is

accumulating in a condenser a low volt current from the battery, reconstitute it as high

creating a brief high intensity magnetic field which will be sent through the distributor at

 25 ft

Indicated Air Speed (IAS) corrected for instrument, position, compressibility and density

Calibrated Air Speed (CAS) corrected for instrument, position, compressibility and density

question:

regulator (as a function of demand and altitude) is to:
1. decrease oxygen pressure from 1800 PSI (in the bottles) down to about
50-75 PSI (low pressure system)
2. supply pure oxygen
3. supply diluted oxygen
4. supply oxygen at normal pressure
5. supply oxygen at emergency/positive pressure
6. trigger the continuous cabin altitude warning at 10000 ft cabin altitude
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:
When carrying out battery condition check using the aircraft's voltmeter:
answer:
a load should be applied to the battery in order to give a better indication
of condition.
choiceone:
no load should be applied to the battery because it would depress the
voltage.
choicetwo: the battery should be isolated.
choicethree: the load condition is unimportant.

question:
Connecting two 12 volt 40 ampere-hour capacity batteries in series will result
in a total voltage and capacity respectively of:
answer: 24 volts, 40 ampere-hours.
choiceone: 12 volts, 40 ampere-hours.
choicetwo: 24 volts, 80 ampere-hours.
choicethree: 12 volts, 80 ampere-hours.

question: A diluter demand oxygen regulator:
answer: delivers oxygen flow when inhaling.
choiceone: delivers oxygen flow only above FL 100.
choicetwo: is only recommended for use with smoke in the cockpit.
choicethree: mixes air and oxygen in a passenger oxygen mask.

question: By-pass turbine engines are mainly used in commercial aviation, because:
answer:
at high subsonic airspeeds they have a better propulsive efficiency than
propeller or straight jet engines.
choiceone: twin spool or triple spool jet engines require a high by pass ratio.
choicetwo: they produce less noise.
choicethree: they are lighter than straight jet engines.

question: The purpose of a voltage regulator is to control the output voltage of the:
answer: generator at varying loads and speeds.
choiceone: batteries at varying loads.
choicetwo: generators at varying speeds and the batteries at varying loads.
choicethree: TRU.

question: The purpose of bonding the metallic parts of an aircraft is to:
answer: provide safe distribution of electrical charges and currents.
choiceone: provide a single earth for electrical devices.
choicetwo:
prevent electrolytic corrosion between mating surfaces of similar
metals.
choicethree: isolate all components electrically.

question:
To reverse the direction of rotation of shunt-type (parallel field) DC electric
motor, it is necessary to:
answer: reverse the polarity of either the stator and the rotor.
choiceone: reverse the polarity of the motor connections.
choicetwo: change the connections from shunt to series.
choicethree: connect a phase-shift capacitor to the field circuit.

question: When AC generators are operated in parallel, they must be of the same:
answer: voltage and frequency.
choiceone: amperage and kVAR.
choicetwo: voltage and amperage.
choicethree: frequency and amperage.

question: Below its design speed, an axial compressor:
answer: has a tendency to surge in the front stages.
choiceone: has a tendency to surge in the rear stages.
choicetwo: has a tendency to surge in the centre stages.
choicethree: has no tendency to surge.

question: Regarding Ohm's law:
answer: The current in a circuit is directly proportional to voltage.
choiceone:
The current in a circuit is directly proportional to the resistance of the
circuit.
choicetwo:
The power in the circuit is inversely proportional to the square of the
current.
choicethree: The current in a circuit is inversely proportional to voltage.

question: Circuit breakers protecting circuits may be:
answer: used in AC and DC circuits.
choiceone: used only in AC circuits.
choicetwo: used only in DC circuits.
choicethree: reset at any time.

question:
The advantages of alternating current on board an aircraft are:
1. simple connection
2. high starting torque
3. flexibility in use
4. lighter weight of equipment
5. easy to convert into direct current
6. easy maintenance of machines
The combination of correct statements is:
Direct current generators are connected:
answer: in parallel to provide maximum power.
choiceone: in series to provide maximum power.
choicetwo: in series to provide maximum voltage.
choicethree: in parallel to provide maximum voltage.

question:
A closed loop control system in which a small power input controls a much
larger power output in a strictly proportionate manner is known as:
answer: a servomechanism.
choiceone: an amplifier.
choicetwo: a feedback control circuit.
choicethree: an autopilot.

question: A piston engine may use a fuel of a different grade than the recommended:
answer: provided that the grade is higher
choiceone: provided that the grade is lower
choicetwo: never
choicethree: provided that it is an aeronautical petrol

question: Fire precautions to be observed before refuelling are:
answer:
All bonding and connections to the earth terminal between ground
equipment and the aircraft should be made before filler caps are
removed.
choiceone: Ground Power Units (GPU) are not to be operated.
choicetwo:
Passengers may be boarded (traversing the refuelling zone) providing
suitable fire extinguishers are readily available.
choicethree:
Aircraft must be more than 10 metres from radar or HF radio equipment
under test.

question:
On detection of a persistent overvoltage fault on an AC generator connected
to the aircraft AC busbars, the on-board protection device opens:
answer: the exciter breaker and the generator breaker.
choiceone: the exciter breaker, the generator breaker and tie breaker.
choicetwo: The generator breaker and tie breaker.
choicethree: The generator breaker.

question: "Nose wheel shimmy" may be described as:
answer:
a possibly damaging vibration of the nose wheel when moving on the
ground.
choiceone:
the oscillatory movement of the nose wheel when extended prior to
landing.
choicetwo:
the amount of free movement of the nose wheel before steering takes
effect.
choicethree: aircraft vibration caused by the nose wheel upon extension of the gear.

question:
A feeder fault on a direct current circuit results from a flux unbalance between
the:
answer: voltage coil and the series winding turn.
choiceone: voltage coil and the series winding.
choicetwo: generator and the series winding turn.
choicethree: shunt exciter and the series winding turn.

question:
The useful work area in an ideal Otto engine indicator diagram is enclosed by
the following gas state change lines
answer: 2 adiabatic and 2 isochoric lines.
choiceone: 2 adiabatic and 1 isothermic lines.
choicetwo: 2 adiabatic and 2 isobaric lines.
choicethree: 2 adiabatic, 1 isochoric and 1 isobaric lines.

question:
A modern Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) is designed to provide power for ground
starting of an engine. It also supplies both in the air (subject to certification
limitations) and on the ground:
answer: air conditioning and electrical services.
choiceone: air conditioning and thrust in the event of engine failure.
choicetwo:
either air conditioning or electrical services, but never both at the same
time.
choicethree:
air conditioning and electrical services (on the ground) electrical and
hydraulic back-up services (in the air).

question:
Ignition occurs in each cylinder of a four stroke engine (TDC = Top Dead
Centre):
answer: before TDC at each second crankshaft revolution.
choiceone: before TDC at each crankshaft revolution.
choicetwo: behind TDC at each crankshaft revolution.
choicethree: behind TDC at each second crankshaft revolution.

question:
When a persistent top excitation limit fault on an AC generator connected to
the mains with another AC generator, the overexcitation protection device
opens:
answer: the exciter breaker, the generator breaker and the tie breaker.
choiceone: the tie breaker.
choicetwo: the exciter breaker and the generator breaker.
choicethree: the generator breaker.

question: The power output of a piston engine can be calculated by:
answer: Torque times RPM.
choiceone: Work times velocity.
choicetwo: Force times distance.
choicethree: Pressure times arm.

question:
The power of a piston engine which will be measured by using a friction brake
is:
answer: Brake horse power.
choiceone: Friction horse power.
choicetwo: Heat loss power.
choicethree: Indicated horse power.

question: With respect to a piston engine aircraft, ice in the carburettor:
answer: may form at OAT's higher than +10°C.
choiceone: will only form at OAT's below +10°C.
choicetwo:
will only form at outside air temperatures (OAT's) below the freezing
point of water.
choicethree: will only form at OAT's below the freezing point of fuel.

question:
When an underspeed fault is detected on an AC generator connected to the
aircraft AC busbar, the protection device opens the:
answer: generator breaker.
choiceone: exciter breaker.
choicetwo: exciter breaker and generator breaker.
choicethree: exciter breaker, generator breaker and tie breaker.

question:
The power of a piston engine decreases during a climb with a constant power
lever setting because of the decreasing:
answer: air density.
choiceone: engine temperature.
choicetwo: humidity.
choicethree: temperature.

question:
The part of a piston engine that transforms reciprocating movement into
rotary motion is termed the:
answer: crankshaft
choiceone: piston
choicetwo: camshaft
choicethree: reduction gear

question: The voltage regulator of a DC generator is connected in:
answer: series with the shunt field coil.
choiceone: series with the armature.
choicetwo: parallel with the shunt field coil.
choicethree: parallel with the armature.

question:
Which one of the following factors would be most likely to increase the
possibility of detonation occurring within a piston engine?
answer: High cylinder head temperature.
choiceone:
The use of a fuel with a high octane rating as compared to the use of
one with a low octane rating.
choicetwo: Using an engine with a low compression ratio.
choicethree: Slightly retarding the ignition timing.

question:
In a piston engine if the ratio of air to fuel, by weight, is approximately 9:1, the
mixture is said to be:
answer: rich
choiceone: weak
choicetwo: too weak to support combustion
choicethree: normal

question:
On starting, in a brushless AC generator with no commutator rings, the
generator is activated by:
answer: a set of permanent magnets.
choiceone: the main field winding.
choicetwo: the stabilizer winding jointly with the voltage regulator.
choicethree: the auxiliary winding.

question:
To ensure that the fuel flow is kept directly proportional to the mass of air
flowing through the choke, thus preventing the main jet supplying excessive
fuel as engine speed is increased, a carburettor is fitted with:
answer: a diffuser
choiceone: a power jet
choicetwo: an accelerator pump
choicethree: a mixture control

question: The capacity of an accumulator is:
answer: The quantity of electricity that the battery can supply during discharge.
choiceone:
The number of cycles (charging and discharging) that a battery can
withstand without deterioration of its cells.
choicetwo: The no-load voltage of the battery multiplied by its rated output current.
choicethree: The intensity withstood by the battery during charging.

question: The oil system for a piston engine incorporates an oil cooler that is fitted:
answer:
in the return line to the oil tank after the oil has passed through the
scavenge pump
choiceone: between the oil tank and the pressure pump
choicetwo: after the pressure pump but before the oil passes through the engine
choicethree:
after the oil has passed through the engine and before it enters the
sump

question: The purpose of a compressor bleed valve is to prevent surging:
answer: at low compressor rpm.
choiceone: generated by foreign object ingestion.
choicetwo: of the first compressor stages.
choicethree: with altitude.

question:
In order to measure temperature, the cylinder head temperature (CHT) gauge
utilises a:
answer: thermocouple consisting of two dissimilar metals.
choiceone: wheatstone bridge circuit.
choicetwo: ratiometer circuit.
choicethree: bourdon tube.

question: Landing gear torque links are used to:
answer: prevent rotation of the landing gear piston in the oleo strut.
choiceone: take up the lateral stresses to which the gear is subjected.
choicetwo: prevent the extension of the landing gear oleo strut rod.
choicethree: maintain the compass heading throughout taxiing and take-off.

question:
When leaning the mixture for the most economic cruise fuel flow, excessive
leaning will cause:
answer: high cylinder head
choiceone: high engine RPM
choicetwo: low cylinder head
choicethree: high manifold pressure

question:
The first indication of carburettor icing in airplanes equipped with constant
speed propellers would most likely be a:
answer: decrease in manifold pressure
choiceone: rough running engine followed by an increase in manifold pressure
choicetwo: decrease in rpm
choicethree: rough running engine followed by loss in rpm.

question:
The illumination of the green landing gear light indicates that the landing gear
is:
answer: locked-down.
choiceone: in the required position.
choicetwo: locked-down and its door is locked.
choicethree: not in the required position.

question:
What will happen to the geometrical pitch angle of a "constant speed
propeller" if the manifold pressure is increased ?
answer: It will increase
choiceone: It will increase and after a short time it will be the same again
choicetwo: It will decrease so that the engine can increase
choicethree: It will remain the same

question:
What will eventually happen during a continuous climb with a mixture setting
full rich?
answer: fouling of spark plugs.
choiceone: increase of the power available.
choicetwo:
the engine will operate smoother even though fuel consumption is
increased.
choicethree: the engine will overheat.

question:
With an aircraft fitted with a fixed pitch propeller, during flight at normal
cruising speed, one magneto fails completely. This will first cause:
answer: loss of approximately 100 rpm
choiceone: additional load on the other magneto
choicetwo: excessive vibration
choicethree: engine to overheat.

question:
In flight, with centre tank empty and APU operating, a fuel unbalance is
detected (quantity in tank 1 < quantity in tank 2).
Rebalancing of the two tanks is:
answer:
possible with "CROSSFEED" open and tank 1 pumps "OFF" and tank 2
pumps "ON".
choiceone: impossible without causing the APU to stop.
choicetwo: possible with "CROSSFEED" open and tank 2 pumps "OFF".
choicethree: impossible because there is no fuel in centre tank.

question: A pilot can actuate the feathering system by:
answer: pulling the propeller control lever rearwards.
choiceone: pushing the propeller control lever forwards.
choicetwo: pushing the power lever forwards.
choicethree: pulling the power levers rearwards.

question: The function of an accumulator in a hydraulic brake system is:
answer:
to supply a limited amount of brake energy in case the hydraulic system
normally powering the brakes does not function anymore.
choiceone: to damp pressure fluctuations of the auto brake system.
choicetwo:
to store the hydraulic energy recovered by the anti skid system to
prevent wheel blocking.
choicethree:
to function as a buffer to assist the hydraulic system during heavy
braking.

question: The use of too low an octane fuel may cause:
answer: detonation
choiceone: higher manifold pressure
choicetwo: a cooling effect on cylinders
choicethree: a prompt pre-ignition reaction.

question:
Consider a jet engine whose control is based on the Engine Pressure Ratio
(EPR):
1. with a constant EPR, the thrust decreases when the altitude increases
2. with a constant EPR, the thrust is independent of the Mach number
3. At same environmental conditions, a given EPR setting maintains the thrust
irrespective of engine wear due to ageing.
4. the EPR is determined by the impact pressure difference between the
turbine outlet and the compressor inlet
5. on take-off, in the event of icing not detected by the crew, the indicated EPR
is lower than the real EPR
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:
Once the engine has started, ignition systems of piston engines are:
answer: independent of the electrical system of the aircraft.
choiceone: dependent on the battery.
choicetwo: dependent on the DC-Generator.
choicethree: dependent on the AC-Generator.

question:
The cylinder head and oil temperature gauges are to exceed the normal
operating ranges if a pilot
answer: uses fuel that has a rating lower-than-specified for the engine
choiceone: uses fuel that has a rating higher-than-specified for the engine
choicetwo: operating wit higher-than-normal oil pressure
choicethree: operates with the mixture control set too rich.

question:
Consider the variable-pitch propeller of a turbo-prop.
During deceleration:
answer:
when braking, the propeller supplies negative thrust and absorbs engine
power.
choiceone:
at zero power, the propeller thrust is zero and the engine power
absorbed is nil.
choicetwo:
when feathered, the propeller produces thrust and absorbs no engine
power.
choicethree:
with propeller windmilling, the thrust is zero and the propeller supplies
engine power.

question: As the flight altitude increases, if no leaning is made with the mixture control:
answer:
the density of air entering the carburettor decreases and the amount of
fuel remains constant
choiceone:
the volume of air entering the carburettor remains constant and the
amount of fuel decreases
choicetwo:
the volume of air entering the carburettor decreases and the amount of
fuel decreases
choicethree:
the density of air entering the carburettor decreases and the amount of
fuel increases.

question:
Among the different types of aircraft structures, the shell structures efficiently
transmit the:
1. normal bending stresses
2. tangent bending stresses
3. torsional moment
4. shear stresses
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

When starting an engine or when the engine runs at an idle rpm on ground,
the mixture is:
answer:
rich, to make starting possible and to cool the engine sufficiently when
idling
choiceone: rich, because the choke valve is closed
choicetwo: rich, because carburettor heat is switched on
choicethree: lean, to prevent hat the engine consumes too much fuel.

question: The application of carburettor heat reduces
answer:
the density of air entering the carburettor, thus enriching the fuel/air
mixture
choiceone:
the volume of air entering the carburettor, thus leaning the fuel/air
mixture
choicetwo:
it reduces the density of air entering the carburettor, thus leaning the
fuel/air mixture
choicethree:
the volume of air entering the carburettor, thus enriching the fuel/air
mixture.

question:
On a non-stressed skin type wing, the wing structure elements which take up
the vertical bending moments Mx are:
answer: the spars.
choiceone: the ribs.
choicetwo: the webs.
choicethree: the skin.

question:
On four-stroke piston engines, the theoretical valve and ignition settings are
readjusted in order to increase the:
answer: overall efficiency
choiceone: compression ratio
choicetwo: piston displacement
choicethree: engine RPM

question:
An impulse coupling does not function at such speeds above those
encountered in starting. Its engaging pawls are prevented from operating at
higher speeds by
answer: centrifugal force
choiceone: engine oil pressure
choicetwo: a coil spring
choicethree: electro-magnetic action of operating magneto.

question:
The modern anti-skid processes are based on the use of a computer whose
input data is:
1. idle wheel speed (measured)
2. braked wheel speed (measured)
3. brake temperature (measured)
4. desired idle wheel train slipping rate
5. tire pressure
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:
The Engine Pressure Ratio (EPR) is computed by:
answer: dividing turbine discharge pressure by compressor inlet pressure.
choiceone: dividing compressor discharge pressure by turbine discharge pressure.
choicetwo: multiplying compressor inlet pressure by turbine discharge pressure.
choicethree: multiplying compressor discharge pressure by turbine inlet pressure.

question: A condenser in parallel with breaker points will
answer: intensify current in secondary winding
choiceone: permit arcing across points
choicetwo: assist in negative feedback to secondary coil
choicethree: assist in collapse of secondary winding.

question: An impulse magneto coupling
answer: gives a retarded spark at starting
choiceone: reduces magneto speed during engine warm-up
choicetwo: advances ignition timing and gives a hotter spark at starting
choicethree: gives an automatic spark increase during high speed operation.

question: The purpose of static wick dischargers is to:
answer:
dissipate static charge of the aircraft in flight thus avoiding radio
interference as a result of static electricity.
choiceone: dissipate static charge from the aircraft skin after landing.
choicetwo: provide a path to ground for static charges when refuelling.
choicethree: be able to fly higher because of less electrical friction.

question:
If an engine fails to stop with the magneto switch in OFF position, the cause
may be:
answer: excessive carbon formation in cylinder head.
choiceone: switch wire grounded
choicetwo: defective condenser
choicethree: fouled spark plugs

question:
If the ground wire between the magneto and the ignition switch becomes
disconnected, the most noticeable result will be that the engine
answer: cannot be shut down by turning the switch to the OFF position.
choiceone: will not operate at the left magneto
choicetwo: will not operate at the right magneto
choicethree: cannot be started with the switch in the ON position

question: A slaved directional gyro derives it's directional signal from:
answer: the flux valve.
choiceone: the air-data-computer.
choicetwo: a direct reading magnetic compass.
choicethree: the flight director.

question: An impulse coupling is installed on a magneto of a piston engine to:
answer: provide a stronger spark on top dead centre for engine starting.
choiceone: advance the ignition timing.
choicetwo: facilitate quick removal and installation.
choicethree: absorb starting loads.

question: Aircraft magneto`s receive electrical energy from
answer: rotating permanent magneto's.
choiceone: batteries
choicetwo: generators
choicethree: condensers

question: The type of windings commonly used in DC starter motors are:
answer: series wound.
choiceone: shunt wound.
choicetwo: series shunt wound.
choicethree: compound wound.

question: Cooling air for a reciprocating engine can be obtained by means of:
answer: ram air
choiceone: a supercharger
choicetwo: a turbocharger
choicethree: a pneumatic system.

question: A chip detector in the oil system of an engine/gearbox is to indicate that
answer: there are metal particles in the oil
choiceone: the piston rings are worn
choicetwo: to indicate that seals are worn
choicethree: the oil temperature is too high

question: The lubricating system of an aircraft engine is used to
answer: aid in dissipation of heat
choiceone: keep the engine warm
choicetwo: prevent inter-crystalline corrosion
choicethree: operate ground adjustable propellers.

question: A relay is:
answer: a magnetically operated switch.
choiceone: another name for a solenoid valve.
choicetwo: a unit that is used to convert electrical energy to heat energy.
choicethree: a device that is used to increase electrical power.

question: A pressure relief valve that does not fit on its seat properly would result in
answer: low oil pressure
choiceone: high oil pressure
choicetwo: excessive oil consumption
choicethree: low oil temperature.

question: It may be determined that an aircraft is not properly bonded if:
answer: static noises can be heard on the radio.
choiceone: a circuit breaker pops out.
choicetwo: there is interference on the VOR receiver.
choicethree: there is heavy corrosion on the fuselage skin mountings.

question: A magnetic plug can be used to
answer: collect ferrous particles reaching the sump
choiceone: prevent metallic particles from entering the oil system
choicetwo: collect carbon found in the oil
choicethree: collect static electricity.

question: A unit that converts electrical DC into AC is:
answer: an inverter.
choiceone: an AC generator.
choicetwo: a transformer rectifier unit.
choicethree: a thermistor.

question: The purposes of the oil and the nitrogen in an oleo-pneumatic strut are:
answer:
the oil supplies the damping function and the nitrogen supplies the
spring function
choiceone:
the oil supplies the spring function and the nitrogen supplies the
damping function.
choicetwo:
the oil supplies the sealing and lubrication function, the nitrogen
supplies the damping function.
choicethree:
the oil supplies the damping and lubrication function, the nitrogen
supplies the heat-dissipation function.

question:
A substance which may never be used in the vicinity or on parts of an oxygen
installation is:
answer: Grease
choiceone: Water
choicetwo: Halon
choicethree: Nitrogen

question: Fixed-pitch propellers are usually designed for maximum efficiency at:
answer: cruising speed
choiceone: idling
choicetwo: full throttle
choicethree: take-off

question: The function of a feed box in the fuel tank is to
answer: increase the fuel level at the boost pump location
choiceone: trap fuel sediments or sludge in the lower part of the tank
choicetwo: distribute the fuel to the various tanks during refuelling
choicethree: ventilate the tank during refuelling under high pressure

question:
The crash/fire axe is part of the safety equipment fitted to passenger aircraft.
Its function is to:
answer:
obtain forced access to a fire behind a panel and a general purpose tool
during evacuation.
choiceone: free exits in case of evacuation via the sides.
choicetwo: activate a radio survival beacon by cutting off the red coloured top
choicethree:
settle an escalating conflict with unreasonable passengers, who
threaten flight safety.

question: A VMO-MMO warning device consists of an alarm connected to:
answer:
a barometric aneroid capsule subjected to a static pressure and an
airspeed sensor subjected to a dynamic pressure.
choiceone:
a barometric aneroid capsule subjected to a dynamic pressure and an
airspeed sensor subjected to a static pressure.
choicetwo:
a barometric aneroid capsule and an airspeed sensor subjected to
dynamic pressure.
choicethree:
a barometric aneroid capsule and an airspeed sensor subjected to a
static pressure.

question:
In order to get the optimum efficiency of a piston engine, the positions of the
intake and exhaust valve at the end of the power stroke are:
answer: both valves open.
choiceone: intake valve closed and exhaust valve open.
choicetwo: both valves closed.
choicethree: exhaust valve closed and intake valve open.

question: The yaw damper system controls:
answer: the rudder, with the angular rate about the yaw axis as the input signal.
choiceone: the ailerons, with Mach Number as the input signal.
choicetwo: the rudder, with Mach Number as the input signal.
choicethree: the ailerons, with the angular rate about the yaw axis as the input signal.

question: The reading of a Mach indicator is independent of:
answer: the outside temperature
choiceone: the static pressure
choicetwo: the total pressure
choicethree: the differential pressure measurement

question:
Regarding the chemical oxygen generator, to enable the oxygen to flow, the
passenger must:
answer: firmly pull the mask towards his face.
choiceone: operate the relevant switch in his armrest.
choicetwo: firmly pull the door compartment of the oxygen mask storage.
choicethree: turn the oxygen valve to open.

question: Hydraulic fluid, entering the hydraulic pump, is slightly pressurised to:
answer: prevent cavitation in the pump.
choiceone: ensure sufficient pump output.
choicetwo: prevent overheating of the pump.
choicethree: prevent vapour locking.

question: Regarding (1) a fuse and (2) a circuit breaker:
answer: (1) is not resettable, (2) is resettable.
choiceone: (1) is suitable for high currents, (2) is not suitable for high currents.
choicetwo: (1) is not suitable for high currents, (2) is suitable for high currents.
choicethree: (1) and (2) are not resettable.

question: Regarding a thermal wing anti-icing system, the correct statement is:
answer:
Aerodynamic performances of the wings are maintained and there is a
reduction of maximum engine thrust.
choiceone:
Aerodynamic performances of the wings are not maintained and there is
no reduction of maximum engine thrust.
choicetwo:
Aerodynamic performances of the wings are maintained and there is no
reduction of maximum engine thrust.
choicethree:
Aerodynamic performances of the wings are not maintained and there is
a reduction of maximum engine thrust.

question:
On design purpose, the relationship between the fuel octane rating and the
maximum compression ratio of a piston engine is:
answer:
the higher the octane rating is, the higher the maximum compression
ratio is
choiceone:
the lower the octane rating is, the higher the maximum compression
ratio is
choicetwo:
the higher the octane rating is, the lower the maximum compression
ratio is.
choicethree: the maximum compression ratio is independent of the octane rating.

question:
On-board electrical systems are protected against faults of the following type:
1. AC generator over-voltage
2. AC generator under-voltage
3. over-current
4. over-speed
5. under-frequency
6. undue vibration of AC generators
The combination of correct statements is:

The airspeed indicator of a twin-engine aircraft comprises different sectors
and colour marks. The blue line corresponds to the:
answer: optimum climbing speed with one engine inoperative, or Vy
choiceone: speed not to be exceeded, or VNE
choicetwo: minimum control speed, or VMC
choicethree: maximum speed in operations, or VMO

question:
When available, the yaw damper indicator supplies the pilot with information
regarding the:
answer: yaw damper action on the rudder

The horizontal command bar of a flight director:

gives information about the direction and the amplitude of the
corrections to be applied on the pitch of the aircraft.
choiceone: repeats the position information given by the ILS in the horizontal plane.

choicethree:

applied on the pitch of the aircraft.

question: The command bars of a flight director:

The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:
Considering a flight director of the "command bars" type:

It operates to counteract the larger than normal forward movements of

choiceone: only one generator can supply the bus-bar at a time.
choicetwo: generator voltages are not equal, dependent on load.
choicethree: one generator comes "on-line" before the other.

question: The octane rating of a fuel characterises the :
answer: the anti-knock capability
choiceone: quantity of heat generated by its combustion
choicetwo: fuel electrical conductivity
choicethree: fuel volatility

question: Under what condition should stalls never be practiced in a twin-engine airplane?
answer: With one engine inoperative.
choiceone: With climb power on.

question: The indication of the fire detection systems is performed by a:

altitude of 31000 ft. What is th
operating crew ?

decompression at an
jal action by the
answer: to put on oxygen masks

question:
operated at FL 450, with 180 passenger seats, what
will be the number of masks available for use
answer: 198 (110% of the seating capacity).

choicetwo: 270 (150% of the seating capacity).
choicethree: 240 (one additional mask per seat block).

question:
(Refer to Figure 85.) What procedure should be followed if communications are lost
before reaching 9,000 feet?
answer:
Continue climb to WAGGE INT, turn left direct to FMG VORTAC, then if at or above
MCA, proceed on assigned route; if not, continue climb in holding pattern until at the
proper altitude.
choiceone:
At 9,000, turn left direct to FMG VORTAC, then via assigned route if at proper altitude;
if not, climb in holding pattern until reaching the proper altitude.
choicetwo:
Continue climb on LOC course to cross WAGGE INT at or above 9,000, turn left direct
to FMG VORTAC to cross at 10,000 or above, and continue on assigned course.

question: If the Pitot head is blocked, what airspeed indication can he expected?
answer: No change of IAS in level flight, even with large power changes.
choiceone: A decrease of IAS during a climb.
choicetwo: Constant IAS during a descent.

question:
(Refer to Figure 87.) Where
Lake Charles?

the VOR COP when flying east on V306 from D:
answer: 30 NM east of DAS.
choiceone: 50 NM east of DAS.
choicetwo: 40 NM east of DAS.

question: How should you preflight check the altimeter prior to an IFR flight?
answer:
Set the altimeter to the current altimeter setting. The indication should be within 75
feet of the actual elevation for acceptable accuracy.
choiceone:
Set the altimeter to 29.92" Hg. With current temperature and the altimeter indication,
determine the true altitude to compare with the field elevation.
choicetwo:
Set the altimeter first with 29.92" Hg and then the current altimeter setting. The
change in altitude should correspond to the change in setting.

question: What are the indications of the pulsating VASI?
answer:
High - pulsing white, on glidepath - steady white, slightly below glide slope steady
red, low - pulsing red.
choiceone: High - pulsing white, on glidepath - green, low - pulsing red.
choicetwo:
High - pulsing white, on course and on glidepath - steady white, off course but on
glidepath - pulsing white and red; low - pulsing red.

question: Identify touchdown zone lighting (TDZL).
answer:
Two rows of transverse light bars disposed symmetrically about the runway
centerline.
choiceone:
Flush centerline lights spaced at 50-foot intervals extending through the touchdown
zone.
choicetwo:
Alternate white and green centerline lights extending from 75 feet from the threshold
through the touchdown zone.

Two rows of transverse light bars disposed symmetrically about the runway
centerline.
choiceone:
Flush centerline lights spaced at 50-foot intervals extending through the touchdown
zone.
choicetwo:
Alternate white and green centerline lights extending from 75 feet from the threshold
through the touchdown zone.

question: If a pitot tube is clogged, which instrument would be affected?
answer: Airspeed indicator.
choiceone: Altimeter.
choicetwo: Vertical speed indicator.

question: A gyroplane will have the greatest tendency to roll during
answer: horizontal flight at high speed.
choiceone: climbing flight in which forward airspeed decreases.
choicetwo: descending flight in which forward airspeed decreases.

question:
When making an airborne VOR check, what is the maximum allowable tolerance
between the two indicators of a dual VOR system (units independent of each other
except the antenna)?
answer: 4 degrees between the two indicated bearings of a VOR.
choiceone: Plus or minus 4 degrees when set to identical radials of a VOR.
choicetwo: 6 degrees between the two indicated radials of a VOR.

question: What is the advantage of a three-bar VASI?
answer: A normal glide angle is afforded both high and low cockpit aircraft.
choiceone: Pilots have a choice of glide angles.
choicetwo: The three-bar VASI is much more visible and can be used at a greater height.

question:
(Refer to Figures 139 and 141.) Which displacement from the localizer centerline and
glide slope at the 1,300-foot point from the runway is indicated?
answer:
21 feet above the glide slope and approximately 320 feet to the left of the runway
centerline.
choiceone:
21 feet below the glide slope and approximately 320 feet to the right of the runway
centerline.
choicetwo:
28 feet above the glide slope and approximately 250 feet to the left of the runway
centerline.

question: Identify runway remaining lighting on centerline lighting systems.
answer: Alternate red and white lights from 3,000 feet to 1,000 feet, then red lights to the end.
choiceone:
Amber lights from 3,000 feet to 1,000 feet, then alternate red and white lights to the
end.
choicetwo: Alternate red and white lights from 3,000 feet to the end of the runway.

question: Identify taxi leadoff lights associated with the centerline lighting system.
answer:
Alternate green and yellow lights curving from the centerline of the runway to a point
on the exit.
choiceone:
Alternate green and yellow lights curving from the centerline of the runway to the
centerline of the taxiway.
choicetwo:
Alternate green and yellow lights curving from the centerline of the runway to the
edge of the taxiway.

question:
In the Northern Hemisphere, which would be correct about starting the rollout from a
turn using a magnetic compass? Start the rollout
answer:
after the compass indication passes south by a number of degrees approximately
equal to the latitude minus the normal rollout lead.
choiceone:
before the compass indication reaches south by a number of degrees approximately
equal to the latitude over which the turn is made plus the pilot's normal lead.
choicetwo:
after the compass indication passes south by a number of degrees approximately
equal to the magnetic variation of the area over which the turn is made plus the
pilot's normal lead.
